comment.brief: Create, schedule and react to notifications created locally
The `ux:Global` attribute creates a global resource that is accessible everywhere in UX markup.
comment.full:
The `ux:Global` attribute creates a global resource that is accessible everywhere in UX markup.

See @Resources for more information.

The `ux:Global` attribute on an UX element creates a single object (singleton) that is globally available.
Using this attribute will prevent the object from being inserted by default the object at its defined location
in the UX tree.

comment.brief: Dismisses all currently active notifications created by our app.
comment.full: Dismisses all currently active notifications created by our app.

comment.brief: Clears the badge number shown on the iOS home screen.
comment.full: Clears the badge number shown on the iOS home screen.

comment.brief: Displays a notification to the user after the time specified by `secondsFromNow` has passed.
comment.full: Displays a notification to the user after the time specified by `secondsFromNow` has passed.

parameters.name: secondsFromNow
parameters.description: How long in seconds until the notification fires.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body text of the notification.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A string that is not shown in the notification itself, but will be present in the callback.

parameters.name: sound
parameters.description: A boolean specifying whether the device should make the default notification sound when it is shown in the notification bar.

parameters.name: badgeNumber
parameters.description: An optional parameter that is only used on iOS to put a badge number against the apps icon. This is often used for showing the quantity of 'things' that need the user's attention. For example an email app could show the number of unread emails.

comment.brief: Instantly displays a notification to the user.
comment.full: Instantly displays a notification to the user.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: The body text of the notification.

parameters.name: payload
parameters.description: A string that is not shown in the notification itself, but will be present in the callback.

parameters.name: sound
parameters.description: A boolean specifying whether the device should make the default notification sound when it is shown in the notification bar.

parameters.name: badgeNumber
parameters.description: An optional parameter that is only used on iOS to put a badge number against the apps icon. This is often used for showing the quantity of 'things' that need the user's attention. For example an email app could show the number of unread emails.

comment.brief: Call `emit` with the given arguments on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full:
Call `emit` with the given arguments on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

The `emit` action is dispatched to the JS thread.

comment.brief: Call `emit("error", reason)` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full: Call `emit("error", reason)` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

comment.brief: Call `emit("error", new Error(reason))` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.
comment.full: Call `emit("error", new Error(reason))` on the underlying JS EventEmitter.

comment.brief: Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.
comment.full:
Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.

The `argsFactory` parameter will be called on the JS
thread with a valid context, allowing us to use it to
generate the arguments to `emit`.

comment.brief: Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.
comment.full:
Call `emit` on the underlying JS EventEmitter with factory-generated arguments.

The `argsFactory` parameter will be called on the JS
thread with a valid context, allowing us to use it to
generate the arguments to `emit`.

Connect a @Callback to an event.

The @Callback will be called whenever the event is triggered.

Connect a @NativeEvent to an event.

The @NativeEvent will be triggered whenever the event is triggered.

comment.brief:
Returns the file source that will be watched by the Context for changes in Fuse preview.
Override in subclasses and return correct file source to support live updates
in Fuse preview.
comment.full:
Returns the file source that will be watched by the Context for changes in Fuse preview.
Override in subclasses and return correct file source to support live updates
in Fuse preview.
